name: treatment of uranium tailing, non-radioactive emission | uranium tailing, non-radioactive emission | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1178/documentation

[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Waste-specific emissions for uranium tailings impoundment leachate. Mixture of a generic dry site (53%) and generic wet site (47%). Short- and long-term emissions to air from dry site (wind erosion of evaporites). Short- and long-term emissions to groundwater from wet site (infiltration leaching).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Average uranium tailings composition from literature references. Transfer coefficients from prospective model, specific to uranium tailings.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data refers to a worldwide average. Dataset contains the mixture of two different generic sites: 53% dry site (actual evaporation > precipitation) and 47% wet site  (actual evaporation < precipitation), according to the worldwide uranium tailings production in 2006.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Mechanically stable tailings impoundment. Closure with clay barrier and reduction of leachate flow for the initial 2000 years. Uranium production from in-situ leaching (ISL) is not heedded.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Tailings model based on observed leachate concentrations in literature. Extrapolated to 80'000 years heeding chemical characteristics. Initial tailings composition from various literature sources.

exchanges.description: EcoSpold01Location=GLO

flow.name: uranium tailing, non-radioactive emission
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste
